text: Jana Kantorová-Báliková or Jana Kantorova-Balikova (born 9 June 1951) is a Slovak poet and translator. She has written her own poetry and won awards for translating the works of other poets. She has also translated prose works by Oscar Wilde, J. K. Rowling and Douglas Adams. ==Life== Kantorová-Báliková was born in Bratislava in 1951. In 1973 she shared the Jan Holly prize for best literary translation. She won the same award in 1981 for her translation of the Ballad of Reading Gaol.Interview with poet and translator Jana KANTOROVA- BÁLIKOVÁ , Literary Centre, Retrieved 26 April 2017 She has published books of poetry in 1976, 1977, 1986 and 1988. These were all published in Bratislava. In addition, her poetry was included in the collection "Shifting Borders: East European Poetries of the Eighties". She has published "Thirst and Elation" and at the same time translated the work of poets including Edgar Allan Poe, Robert Browning and William Blake. She has also translated Oscar Wilde, J.K.Rowling and Douglas Adams. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:People from Bratislava Category:Slovak translators Category:20th-century Slovak women writers Category:20th-century Slovak writers Category:Slovak women poets Category:20th-century poets
title: Jana Kantorová-Báliková
